skill.name: when-reviewing-code-comprehensively-use-code-review-assistant
skill.description: Comprehensive PR review with multi-agent swarm specialization for security, performance, style, tests, and documentation
skill.summary: Comprehensive PR review with multi-agent swarm specialization for security, performance, style, test...
skill.author: DNYoussef

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation and process skill containing no executable code. It provides guidelines for orchestrating code review agents using claude-flow. All referenced shell commands are documented examples for agent execution, not malicious payloads. The skill focuses on legitimate security scanning, linting, and test coverage analysis.

content.value_statement: Manual code reviews are slow and inconsistent. This skill orchestrates 4 specialized AI agents that analyze pull requests in parallel for security vulnerabilities, performance bottlenecks, code style issues, test coverage gaps, and documentation completeness with merge readiness scoring.
actual_capabilities: Orchestrates 4 specialized agents (security, performance, style, testing, documentation)
Detects OWASP Top 10 vulnerabilities and hardcoded secrets
Identifies performance bottlenecks and N+1 query patterns
Validates ESLint, Prettier, and TypeScript compliance
Measures test coverage against configurable thresholds
Calculates merge readiness score with auto-fix suggestions
limitations: Requires claude-flow and npm tooling installed
Cannot fix complex issues automatically (only style violations)
Review quality depends on code complexity and testability
External tool results (npm audit, gitleaks) required for full scans

use_cases.title: PR quality gate
use_cases.description: Run automated reviews on every pull request to catch issues before merge

use_cases.title: Vulnerability detection
use_cases.description: Scan code for SQL injection, XSS, hardcoded secrets, and OWASP violations

use_cases.title: Code quality metrics
use_cases.description: Track test coverage, lint errors, and documentation completeness across releases

prompt_templates.title: Quick review
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the code-review-assistant skill to review PR #123 for security issues, performance problems, and test coverage gaps

prompt_templates.title: Full analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Run a comprehensive code review on this pull request covering all 5 dimensions: security, performance, style, testing, and documentation. Report the merge readiness score

prompt_templates.title: Security focus
prompt_templates.prompt: Run only the security review phase of the code-review-assistant. Check for OWASP violations, hardcoded secrets, and authentication issues

prompt_templates.title: CI integration
prompt_templates.prompt: Execute the full code review swarm with CI/CD integration. Generate the merge readiness report and auto-fix script. Fail the build if score is below 80

output_examples.input: Review PR #456 with the code-review-assistant skill
output: Merge Approved: No - 4 blocking issues must be fixed

best_practices: Run reviews on every PR before manual review to save time
Apply auto-fixes first (style violations) then address complex issues
Set appropriate thresholds based on project criticality (80 for critical systems, 70 for utilities)
Track review scores over time to identify quality trends
anti_patterns: Waiting until merge time to run reviews - catch issues early in the PR cycle
Ignoring low scores without investigating root causes
Using default thresholds for all projects without adjusting for criticality
Not integrating with CI/CD - reviews become optional and inconsistent

faq.question: What AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Compatible with Claude, Claude Code, and Codex for orchestrating multi-agent code reviews.

faq.question: What is the merge readiness score?
faq.answer: Weighted score (Security 30%, Performance 25%, Style 15%, Testing 20%, Docs 10%). Merge approved when score is 80+ with zero blocking issues.

faq.question: Can it integrate with my CI/CD pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes. Includes GitHub Actions workflow example that runs on pull requests and fails the build if score is below threshold.

faq.question: Is my code data safe?
faq.answer: Code analysis runs locally using your existing tools. No code is sent to external services beyond your configured AI tool.

faq.question: Why did the review time out?
faq.answer: Large PRs may exceed default timeout. Increase REVIEW_TIMEOUT env var or review specific paths with --files flag.

faq.question: How is this different from linting tools?
faq.answer: Linting tools check syntax and style. This skill provides comprehensive analysis including security vulnerabilities, performance bottlenecks, test coverage gaps, and documentation completeness with agent-powered insights.
